result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian A. Brunsch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brian A. Brunsch is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brian A. Brunsch was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

03:22 pm - Defendant Brian A. Brunsch in court with attorney Anne Marie Katte.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to amend Count 2 to reflect misdemaeanor battery with domestic abuse enhancer a Class A Misdemeanor - 940.19(1)  and Dismiss Count 1 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest.  Plea quesionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  State files Victim Impact Statement and Exhibit 1 (CD of photos taken of defendant/victim)Marked and Rec'd.  Michlig/Katte/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP 18 months
CC/DNA Surchage/Domestic Abuse Surcharge/Supervision Fees
AODA assessment and recovery
Participate in Anger Management Program as directed by PO
Community Service 50 hours
Jail 10 days - Presentent Jail credit 1 day - W/Huber for all purposes - To commence on/before 4-6-15 at 8 am
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given

02:53 pm - Defendant Brian A. Brunsch in court with attorney Anne Marie Katte.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michlig states case is not yet resolved.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
from JA directing payment of attorney fees

Defendant Brian A. Brunsch in court with attorney Anne Marie Katte.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 03:14 pm - Defendant Brian A. Brunsch in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states ineligible for PD - Requests court appointed attorney.  PFAC filed with court.  Court finds defendant partially indigent and appoints Anne Katte - to repay $50/month.  Katte in receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Set for prelim - time limits waived.  Bail continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 16, 2014 at 11:30 am.
